articles.title: OPINION: Prediction markets make gambling an intelligence asset
articles.summary: Someone's arguing that prediction markets transform what looks like gambling into actual intelligence gathering that benefits society. If regulators buy this framing, it could finally give prediction markets the legitimacy they need to operate without constantly dodging gaming laws.

articles.title: 2 of the Best Prediction Market Stocks to Buy Now
articles.summary: Some finance publication is pushing prediction market stocks as hot investment picks right now. If these companies are getting Wall Street attention, it probably means the sector is hitting mainstream momentum that could bring more liquidity and legitimacy to the markets we actually bet on.

articles.title: Strait of Hormuz bets whipsaw on Kalshi amid U.S.-Iran conflict
articles.summary: Prediction markets on Kalshi are seeing wild swings in bets about whether the Strait of Hormuz will be blocked, as tensions escalate between the U.S. and Iran. The volatility shows how geopolitical events can create trading opportunities for sharp bettors who can separate real risk from media hype around critical chokepoints.

articles.title: Prediction markets indicate oil pop Monday, 20% rise this month
articles.summary: Prediction markets are betting on oil prices surging Monday and climbing 20% through the month, signaling traders expect a major supply disruption or geopolitical shock. The crude oil spike represents one of the biggest monthly moves markets are pricing in this year, creating serious profit opportunities for anyone positioned ahead of the crowd.

articles.title: Polymarket Iran Bets Hit $529 Million as New Wallets Win Big
articles.summary: Trading volume on Polymarket's Iran-related prediction markets has exploded to $529 million, with fresh wallets apparently scoring major wins on geopolitical bets. The massive influx of new money signals either serious institutional players entering the space or sophisticated traders capitalizing on Middle East volatility that traditional markets struggle to price.

articles.title: Who is Michael Selig? Meet the Trump administration's prediction market regulator
articles.summary: Michael Selig will oversee prediction market regulation in the Trump administration, putting him at the center of decisions that could reshape how Americans bet on politics and current events. His approach to enforcement and rule-making will determine whether platforms like Kalshi and Polymarket face stricter oversight or get the regulatory breathing room they've been lobbying for.

articles.title: The Chaos Of Khamenei Prediction Markets
articles.summary: Prediction markets are struggling to price Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei's political future, creating wild swings and conflicting odds across platforms. The volatility reveals how geopolitical uncertainty can break traditional forecasting models, offering both massive profit potential and spectacular losses for traders willing to bet on Middle Eastern regime stability.

articles.title: Polymarket defends its decision to allow betting on war as ‘invaluable’
articles.summary: Polymarket is pushing back against critics who question whether people should be able to bet on military conflicts, calling such markets "invaluable" for information gathering. The defense comes as prediction platforms face growing scrutiny over the ethics of monetizing human tragedy, a debate that could shape how regulators treat geopolitical betting markets going forward.

articles.title: Anonymous Kalshi User Makes Huge Bet That the White House Is About to Confirm Alien Life or Technology
articles.summary: An anonymous trader just dropped serious money on Kalshi betting that the White House will officially confirm the existence of alien life or extraterrestrial technology in the near future. This kind of asymmetric bet suggests either insider knowledge or someone willing to risk big on what most consider a long-shot event, making it a fascinating case study in how prediction markets price seemingly impossible outcomes.

articles.title: Bitcoin Needs a Huge Rally to Hit $150,000 by December -- Are Polymarket's 12% Odds Too Low, Too High, or Just About Right?
articles.summary: Polymarket bettors are giving Bitcoin just 12% odds of hitting $150,000 by December, despite the crypto's notorious volatility and recent institutional adoption momentum. This low probability suggests either the market is being overly conservative about Bitcoin's rally potential, or traders have learned hard lessons from previous hype cycles and are pricing in the massive 3x gain required more realistically.

articles.title: Crypto Prediction Markets Say Bitcoin Is Nowhere Near $150,000 -- but Here's the Bull Case They Might Be Missing
articles.summary: Crypto prediction markets are pricing Bitcoin well below the $150,000 target that bulls keep pushing, suggesting the crowd thinks those sky-high predictions are pure hopium. The disconnect between market wisdom and maximalist dreams creates a potential arbitrage opportunity for bettors who think the prediction markets are underestimating Bitcoin's next bull run.

articles.title: Kalshi and Polymarket Are Economic Oracles
articles.summary: Prediction markets like Kalshi and Polymarket have evolved beyond entertainment betting into sophisticated economic forecasting tools that reveal real-time sentiment about everything from elections to inflation. Smart money is already using these platforms as leading indicators, making them essential reading for anyone trying to predict where markets and politics are heading next.
